column15: Source
column16: Notes

column15: Reuters - Ivory Coast imposes travel restrictions as Ebola fears spread / ABC News - Ivory Coast lifts Ebola flight restrctions
column16: Ivory Coast closed airports to flights to and from Ebola affected areas.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures / World Food Programme - Ebola Outbreak: Logistics Cluster Situation Update 26 September 2014
column16: Senegal has closed air border to Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone. On 25/9/14 humanitarian air-bridge between Dakar, Senegal and three affected countries was opened.

column15: Express - Zambia border controls
column16: Zambia bans nationals from travelling to affected countries and entry of travellers from affected region.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Chad has suspended all flights from Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Chad has suspended all flights from Nigeria.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Cameroon has suspended all flights to Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Cameroon has suspended all flights from Nigeria.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Cameroon has lifted ban on travellers from Senegal.

column15: South Sudan US Embassy - Travel Advisory Security Message for U.S. Citizens
column16: South Sudan has suspended all flights to and from Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Nambia banned entry to travellers from Ebola infected areas.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Nambia banned entry to travellers from Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone in the 21 days prior to travel.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Nambia banned entry to travellers from Nigeria in the 21 days prior to travel.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Cape Verde banned entry to travellers from Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone for three months.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Cape Verde banned entry to travellers from Nigeria for three months.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Rwanda has banned entry to travellers who have visited Guinea, Liberia or Sierra Leone in the 22 days prior to travel.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: South Africa restricted entry to all non-citizens travelling from Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone although assured that this could be waived for 'absolutely essential travel'.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Kenya has suspended entry of travellers from Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone excluding health professionals supporting Ebola response and/or Kenyan citizens.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Gabon has banned all flights from countries affected by Ebola.

column15: BBC News - Senegal Defends Guinea Border Closure
column16: Senegal has re-closed land border with Guinea. Supposedly humanitarian transport is allowed through but this has been disputed by those in the field.

column15: Daily Mail - Liberia President Orders New Anti Ebola Measures
column16: All borders closed except for three: one into sierra leone (Bo Waterside Crossing), one into guinea (Foya Crossing) and one that crosses both (Ganta Crossing).

column15: FCO - Foreign Travel Advice Liberia
column16: The Bo Waterside Crossing to Sierra Leone and the Foya Crossing to Guinea are now also closed.

column15: AF Reuters - Ivory Coast Closes Border
column16: Ivory Coast closes land border with Liberia and Guinea and all official entry points into Liberia and Guinea are closed. Announced opening of 'humanitarian corridor' on 1/9/14.

column15: The Guardian - Guinea Closes Borders / Xinhuanet - Guinea Sets Up Anti-Ebola Measures
column16: Guinea closes land borders with Sierra Leone and Liberia. Guinean government plans to set up 15 health control points along these borders.

column15: Reuters - Guinea-Bissau closes border with Guinea
column16: Guinea-Bissau closes land border with Guinea.

column15: ITV - Chad to close borders with Nigeria in bid to stop Ebola / OCHA - West and Central Africa Region Weekly Regional Humanitarian Snapshot
column16: Chad closed land border with Nigeria at Lake Chad. On 20/9/14, Chad opened a corridor along the border with Nigeria to permit trade between the two countries.

column15: IRIN - West Africa gears up to contain Ebola spread
column16: Cameroon closed land border with Nigeria. Note refugees fleeing Boko Haram attacks have been crossing the border.

column15: AllAfrica - Ivory Coast Imposed Economic Blockade
column16: Ivory Coast temporarily blocked access to sea ports being used as a trans-shipment point under the ebola outbreak.

column15: Channel News Asia - Seaport Restrictions
column16: Liberia denying any crew to disembark at seaports until Ebola epidemic subsided.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Cameroon closed sea border with Nigeria.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Senegal closed its sea border to vessels from Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone.

column15: International SOS - Travel security advisories - Flight bans and closures
column16: Gabon has banned all ships from countries affected by Ebola.

column15: Source
column16: Notes

column15: Channel News Asia - Sierra Leone Law Ebola Victims
column16: Outlawed the “harbouring” of Ebola victims - risk a jail sentence of up to two years.

column15: Vox - Lockdown MSF
column16: Entire population not allowed to leave homes for 3 days to reduce spread.

column15: Business Council Africa - African Security Issues
column16: Blocking cars from moving in and out of affected areas. 16 checkpoints on major roads and foot patrols.

column15: Business Council Africa - African Security Issues
column16: Blocking cars from moving in and out of affected areas. 16 checkpoints on major roads and foot patrols.

column15: Agence France-Presse - Sierra Leone quarentines one million / City Press - Ebola: Sierra Leone quarantines
column16: Corridors for travel to and from non-quarantined areas have been established but will only operate between 9am and 5pm.

column15: Agence France-Presse - Sierra Leone quarentines one million / City Press - Ebola: Sierra Leone quarantines
column16: Corridors for travel to and from non-quarantined areas have been established but will only operate between 9am and 5pm.

column15: Agence France-Presse - Sierra Leone quarentines one million / City Press - Ebola: Sierra Leone quarantines

column15: Government of Sierra Leone - Press Release
column16: Homes will be quarantined when suspected cases are identified.

column15: AllAfrica - Liberia: Stay Home Orders Extended
column16: All non-essential workers have been told not to come to work with promise that all government workers would still be paid.

column15: BBC News - Ebola: Liberia Shuts Schools to Tackle Outbreak
column16: All schools are closed.

column15: Al Jazeera - Liberia Declares Curfew
column16: Night-time curfew of 21.00-06.00 imposed. No mentioned of the breach consequences.

column15: AllAfrica - Government lifts quarantine and adjust curfew
column16: Night-time curfew updated to 23.00-06.00 for more reasonable hours longer term.

column15: Monrovia Inquirer - AFL Launches Operation White Shield
column16: Quarantined by government. Military checkpoints and restricted movement of people.

column15: Monrovia Inquirer - AFL Launches Operation White Shield
column16: Quarantined by government. Military checkpoints and restricted movement of people.

column15: Monrovia Inquirer - AFL Launches Operation White Shield
column16: Quarantined by government. Military checkpoints and restricted movement of people. 35 known "illegal" entry points to Sierra Leone with order of shoot on sight.

column15: Monrovia Inquirer - AFL Launches Operation White Shield
column16: Quarantined by government. Military checkpoints and restricted movement of people.

column15: AllAfrica - Liberia Operation White Shield
column16: Quarantined by government.

column16: Restricted movement of people.

column16: Military roadblocks.

column16: Military roadblocks.

column15: UNMIL - Situation Report
column16: Quarantine led by AFL taskforce.

column15: Associated Press - Liberian Forces Seal Slum / Reuters - Celebration in Liberia slum as Ebola quarantine lifted
column16: Quarantine was controversial within the slum.

column15: Daily Mail - Quarantined Gunpoint / AllAfrica - Government lifts Quarantine and adjust curfew
column16: Weapon guarded quarantine with 20,000 people inside but lifted due to positive results vis-à-vis ebola.

column15: Heritage Liberia - No Access to Bomi
column16: Movement out of Monrovia - particularly towards quarantined Bomi - is being restricted by the military.

column15: Monrovia Inquirer - AFL Launches Operation White Shield
column16: Restricted movement of people.

column15: Heritage Liberia - No Access to Bomi
column16: Restricted movement of people and military presence.

column16: Restricted movement of people and military presence. Order to shoot at Sierra Leones crossing the border.

column16: Military presence.

column16: Military roadblocks.

column15: Daily Observer - Government Closes Nimba Grand Gedeh Boundary
column16: The border crossing between Grand Gedeh and Nimba is closed. Crossing at Cestor River closed with military presence.

column15: Daily Observer - Government Closes Nimba Grand Gedeh Boundary
column16: The border crossing between Bong and Nimba (St Paul River) is closed.

column15: Monrovia Inquirer - AFL Launches Operation White Shield
column16: The border crossing between Lofa and Bong countries (St. Paul's Bridge) is closed with military checkpoint.

column15: Africa Review - Guinea postpones reopening of schools
column16: Government announces schools will not open for the new school year until ebola has subsided.

column15: Guinea News - Health Emergency Declaration in Guinea
column16: Non-specific 'cordon sanitaire' declared and restriction of movement mentioned.

column15: News Observer - Ebola surging in
column16: Authorities restricting access.

column15: Polity - Ebola outbreak reaches Senegal, riots break out in Guinea
column16: 24-hour curfew imposed after riots broke out in response to health workers spraying market with disinfectant without notice.

column15: International SOS - Latest News
column16: WHO quarantine zone.

column15: BBC - Nigeria closes all schools / Agence France-Presse - Most, but not all, of Nigeria’s students back to school after Ebola lay off
column16: The re-opening of schools was postponed until 22 September (earlier than original plan of 13 October) due to Ebola concerns.

column15: Agence France-Presse - Most, but not all, of Nigeria’s students back to school after Ebola lay off
column16: School ban remains in Lagos until 8 October.
